title: Calories in a T-Bone Steak
meta_description: Discover calories in t bone steak for a typical 200g serving, including protein, fat, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks.
assumptions: Typical 200g cooked (grilled) T-bone steak, separable lean and fat, trimmed to 1/8" fat, choice grade, no added sauces or marinades.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut size, fat trim, cooking method, grade, and brand. Check labels or use a nutrition app for precision.

quick_answer.text: A 200g grilled T-bone steak provides ~542 kcal and ~51 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Trim all visible fat before cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in one T-bone steak?
faqs.a: About 542 kcal for a 200g grilled T-bone steak with lean and fat.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a T-bone steak?
faqs.a: Roughly 51 g protein in a 200g serving.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in T-bone?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling or broiling keeps it lower; frying adds oil and calories.

faqs.q: How much fat is in T-bone steak?
faqs.a: About 37 g total fat in 200g, with 15 g saturated.

faqs.q: Are T-bone steaks high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, around 170 mg in 200g—mostly from the meat itself.
